head.title: Paid Notice: Deaths FIALA, RUDOLPH J.

hedline.hl1: Paid Notice: Deaths FIALA, RUDOLPH J.

block.p: FIALA-Rudolph J. Of Pound Ridge, NY, on September 14. Beloved husband of the late Susan for 51 years. Loving father of Jennifer, Christopher, Pamela, Timothy and Geoffrey, and cherished grandfather of Sarah, Andrew, Peter, Robin, Wendy, Emily, Deborah, Colleen, Marina, Thomas and Maggie. Born January 25, 1922, in Berwyn, IL. Basketball star and debating champion of Pontiac High School, Pontiac, IL. Recipient of the Distinguished Flying Cross, six Oak Leaf Clusters and Purple Heart as 1st Lieutenant and navigator of ''Miss Nadine,'' a B-17 in the 11th Bombardment Group of the 42nd Squadron of the 7th Air Force, completing more than 40 missions in the Pacific arena during WWII. Graduated Knox College, Galesburg, IL, 1946. Advertising career spanned four decades as award-winning copywriter and creative director, principally with Doyle Dane Bernbach and Lois Holland Calloway. A memorial service will be held at 1:30 PM, on Thursday, September 21, at the Pound Ridge Community Church in the Pound Ridge Hamlet. In lieu of flowers, the family would appreciate contributions to The Hiram Halle Memorial Library, Pound Ridge, NY 10576.
